content: Apple Stocks Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 26 Mar 2019Anything to learn or perhaps pick out from Appleâ€™s big announcement? Seems to me it affected other companies more than itself1 answerAnswerBump1
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Leonard TanLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 27 Mar 2019Yes it did.  Just after the announcments. Shares down 1.21%. Meanwhile, Roku up 4.68% and Netflix up 1.45%.Apple basically went listing the services they plan to go into, validating the streaming market- which benefitted Netflix in general. No surprise there. Roku went up with as it was made known AAPL's streaming service would be available on their TV devices. Update: The gains have evaporated in the subsequent trading day. Again the buy in was probably just headline traders adding short term volume. Apple Cards were a surprise however, building up on Apple Pay platform, although with the saturation of e-payments, Apple Pay has never been too attractive in the eyes of investors. No announcements concerning its traditional product line were announced.  Anything on Macbooks/new Final Cut Pros would have been loved by the the public. Magazines on iPad really??? Such a pity with all the hype for this.0 comments1
